p:
The Hirshfeld surface provides evidence for C–H
⋯ π
interactions (between hydrogen atoms of the phenyl ring of an azobenzene arm and the carbon atoms of the ring from the neighboring star) beyond dispersion, which further links the stars into columns. These contacts have the largest fraction of 13.3% from the intermolecular interactions in the crystal. The separation of these contacts is 2.57
A ˚
( Figure 4c).
